RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Bacharel em Fsica pelo Instituto de Fisica da Universidade de Sao Paulo (2003), Mestrado no mesmo Instituto (2007) e doutorado pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronautica (ITA) (2013). Foi Pos-doc (CAPES) junto ao IAG-USP desenvolvendo algoritmos que rabalham com correlao de molculas pr-biticas (superviso do Prof Janot-Pacheco e colaborao com o grupo do OCA) e posd-doc (Fapesp) junto ao INPE, sob a superviso do Prof. C. A. Wuensche no desenvolvimento de uma das pipelines do BINGO. Foi Pesquisadora Visitante na UCL(Fapesp-BEPE), supervisionada pelo Prof. Filipe Abdalla no desenvolvimento de um modulo especifico para anlise de no-gaussianidade dentro do ambiente BINGO. Atualmente pesquisadora junto ao IFUSP no projeto BINGO e AliCPT. No BINGO desenvolve aspectos da pipeline, sob a superviso do Prof Elcio Abdalla e Prof. Filipe Abdalla, concernentes a mtodos de separao de componentes para recuperao do sinal de 21 cm. No AliCPT colabora com a Prof. Larissa Santos, da Universidade de YangZhou, China, na mesma area de separao de componentes, mas voltada a aspectos da polarizao da CMB. Paralelamente desenvolve estudos no que tange a Histria da Cincia, sempre em colaborao com o Prof Antonio Videira UERJ-CBPF.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Tecnologia Em Projetos Mecnicos from Faculdade de Tecnologia de So Paulo (1997), graduation at Bacharelado Em Fsica from Universidade de So Paulo (2003), master's at Physics from Universidade de So Paulo (2007) and doctorate at Physics from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2013). Has experience in Astronomy, acting on the following subjects: fsica quntica de poucos corpos, calormetro, astrofsica, fsica de altas energias and fsica nuclear.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Cosmology is living, arguably, its ''Golden Era'', with high quality data, simulations and theory/modelling acting together to produce a picture of the Universe in large scale. The current view is that it can be well described by the so-called $\Lambda$-Cold Dark Matter model (hereafter $\Lambda$CDM) . Nevertheless, a number of challenges still remain to be answered within the context of this model, among them the origin and details of ''Dark Energy'' . $\Lambda$CDM) model must be extensively tested against different cosmological observables, being, nowadays, the CMB undoubtedly one of the best dataset to perform such consistency tests.
Another interesting topic related to "dark energy" arises from study of Baryonic Acoustic Oscillations (BAO), which is recognized as one of the most powerful probes of the properties of Dark Energy. However, given the implications of these measurements, it is important that they are confirmed in other wavebands and measured over a wide range of redshifts. The radio band provides a unique and complementary observational window for the understanding of Dark Energy via the redshifted 21cm neutral hydrogen emission line from distant galaxies.
The BINGO (BAO from Integrated Neutral Gas Observations) radio telescope is a proposed new instrument designed specifically to observe such a signal and to provide a new insight into the Universe. It will be a static radio telescope with a field of view $\sim 15 ^{\circ}$, very good optics and will use intensity mapping as its strategy. BINGO will be provide the first detection of the BAOs using this method, providing a fundamental contribution to the study of Dark Energy.
Regarding CMB, the temperature and polarization anisotropies are powerful tools to study the physics of the early universe. In the next few years, several projects aiming to uncover the B-mode signal will be collecting data, including the Ali Cosmic Polarization Telescope (AliCPT) designed to be a counterpart in the Northern sky of many CMB experiments already located at the South Hemisphere. This project has the aim of using the component separation as powerful tool in order to achieve precise recovering of 21 cm and CMB polarization in both experiments.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Colaborao com o Prof Carlos A. Wuenshe no estudo e divulgao da Astrobiologia, alm de trabalho relacionado a estudo de biotraadores em regies de formao estelar. Neste ltimo exploramos pontos conceituais como uma cosmologia da formao dos CHONs em estrelas de Pop III.

BINGO is a unique radio telescope designed to make the first detection of Baryon Acoustic Oscillations (BAO) at radio frequencies by measuring the distribution of neutral hydrogen gas at cosmological distances. Along with the cosmic microwave background, the scale of BAO is one the most powerful probes of cosmological pa- rameters, including dark energy. The main BINGO partners are Brazil, United Kingdom, Switzerland and Uruguay. Assembly will take place in Brazil with most of the components supplied by Brazilian industry. An important motivation for the project is the training of Brazilian engineers, technicians and postdocs in the skills required so that in the future they can get involved in state-of-the-art radio astronomy systems, specially the Square Kilometer Array. This proposal is linked to ?Projeto Temtico 2014/07885-0" and contemplates an important contribution to the BINGO system calibration and data analysis pipeline. The work will be conducted at INPE, and will require involvement with the hardware, horns and electronics working groups. It is expected the proponent to be the (or one of the) bridge person between the pipeline software and calibration working groups. This working plan will focus on the construction of the pipeline and the receiver noise characterization and modeling at INPE, during 2018 and early 2019, and data analysis and software adequacy for the science program from early 2019 to early 2021.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: BINGO is a unique radio telescope designed to make the first detection of Baryon Acoustic Oscillations (BAO) at radio frequencies by measuring the distribution of neutral hydrogen gas at cosmological distances. Along with the cosmic microwave background, the scale of BAO is one the most powerful probes of cosmological parameters, including dark energy. The partners in BINGO are Brazil, United Kingdom, Switzerland, Uruguay and Saudi Arabia. The overall cost of the project, including personnel costs, is estimated to be 3.5 million US dollars. The current request is for 1.34 million US dollars to fund primarily the capital cost of the components for the 50 receiver modules and their assembly. It is expected that assembly will take place in Brazil and that the majority of the components will also be supplied by Brazilian industry. An important motivation for the project is the training of Brazilian engineers and technicians in the skills required so that in the future they can produce state-of-theart radio astronomy systems. To this end the plan is for the prototype receiver module to be constructed and tested at the world-renowned Jodrell Bank Centre for Astrophysics in Manchester by a joint UK/Brazilian team. In this way the Brazilian team will acquire the skills required to assemble and test the remainder of the modules back.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Pressupostos e consequncias da dupla descoberta do mson pi: o desenvolvimento da fsica brasileira entre 1934 e 1967
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste trabalho consiste, num primeiro momento, em descrever o ambiente cientfico e os primeiros resultados obtidos por Jayme Tiomno (1920-2011) nos primeiros anos aps a concluso do curso de bacharelado e licenciatura em fsica na Universidade do Brasil, localizada na cidade do Rio de Janeiro. Num segundo momento descreveremos o impacto de suas pesquisas tanto internacionalmente como nacionalmente.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Astrobiologia em envelopes proto-planetrios usando modelos de tranferncia radiativa tridimensionais
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto de pesquisa prev uma contribuio significativa no estudo e interpretao dos dados obtidos pelo ALMA. Tal contribuio consistir na impletao do cdigo HDUST para molculas, especialmente C-O. Atualmente o HDUST amplamente utilizado na simulao dos espectros de linhas de Lyman do tomo de H para, por exemplo, estudo de estrelas do tipo Be. Esta implementao permitir uma melhor interpretao dos dados obtidos pelos radio telescpios, especialmente dados do ALMA, de forma a entender a possibilidade de que os espectros encontrados sejam de molculas ou, futuramente, de bio traadores. Alm disso, h a necessidade de aprimorar os clculos existentes no IR e expand-los para UV e Rdio, permitindo assim a construo dos esquemas de reaes qumicas que levam formao de molculas orgnicas mais complexas. Este projeto se insere num contexto maior, de uma colaborao cientfica que mantemos com colegas do Observatoire de la Cte d?Azur e da Universit de Nice-Sophia Antipolis, visando estudos em astrobiologia de longo termo, em particular de exoplanetas, desde sua formaao. E ainda colaboraes com o PreBiotic-ALMA e BEEST.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Astrobiologia em envelopes proto-planetrios usando modelos de tranferncia radiativa tridimensionais

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: From Earth to the universe: alternative approaches in searching for life elsewhere
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The Universe actual chemical composition is basically hydrogen. Heavier elements form through nucleosynthesis inside stars and, from those, a rich chemistry comes out in particular astrophysical locations as molecular clouds and interstellar gas. Therewith, simpler elements recombine in successive reaction paths, generating two-, three- and even four-atom compounds. Hydrogen, carbon, oxygen and nitrogen easily react forming H2O, NH3, CO, CH4, and CO2. So on, more complex organics such as formaldehyde (HCOH), hydrogen cyanide (HCN), methanol (CH2OH), formic acid (HCOOH), glycoaldehyde (HCOH2) are shown to appear driven by proper catalysis, as it was successfully detected in several Miller & Urey laboratory experiments. This project is intended to feed evidence on how those robust prebiotic reactions could have shaped a life-friendly Universe, providing solid arguments for future observational instruments and science. More information about our results will be founded in:From Earth to the universe: alternative approaches in searching for life elsewhere, Janot-Pacheco, E., Friaa, A.,Fornazier-Guimares, K.S.,Galante, D., Wuensche, C.A., Boechat-Roberty, H. & Lage, C. 2016, to be submitted to Astrobiology. - ?Miller & Urey in the Interstellar Medium -Unveilingthe whole from its parts?, Lage, C., Janot-Pacheco, E.,Fornazier-Guimares, K.S.,Rachid, M.G.,Bendjoya, Ph., Domiciano de Souza, A., 2015, in preparation for Astrobiology, Hypothesis paper.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This work is related to FRACS code, mainly in its improvement for different velocity fields in circumstellar medium (such as keplerian rotation) and different aspects for density and temperatures for circumstellar envelopes. Also we intend to include spectral lines in this code, mainly those for simple atoms (suc as H and He) and also for more complex molecules (such as CO, PAH). Those lines are related to observed transitions in young circumstellar disks (Herbig), Be and super-giants B[e]. Besides that improvement we also have to improve the emission calculation in the continuum for several physical processess, specialy for free-free type and bound-free type emissions. The images generated using FRACS code for continuum regions and lines calculated will be used in order to analyse those observations performed by VLTI (AMBER, MIDI, MATISSE) and ALMA, as described in Mapping prebiotic carbon compounds in protoplanetary disks, ALMA proposal Janot-Pacheco, E., Lage, C., Chesneau, O., Suarez, O., Domiciano, A. de S., Carciofi, A., Lopez, B., Vakili, A., Bendjoya, P. 2013.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: The FRACS (Fast Ray-Tracing Algorithm for Circumstellar Structures) code has been used as a numerical tool by many astrophysical groups. This program make use of ray-tracing technique to generate a bi-dimensional stellar image and is based on quadtree meshes for numerical processing. However, for some specific input parameters the generated image presents some aliases. One of our projects is the elimination of those aliases with low impact on processing time while preserving the physical modeling.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Implementao do cdigo FRACS de forma a torn-lo mais eficiente, utilizando tcnicas de HPC

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Participao na identificao de estrelas Be no campo 12 da misso K2 do satlite Kepler no LNA.

This work is related to FRACS code, mainly in its improvement for different velocity fields in circumstellar medium (such as keplerian rotation) and different aspects for density and temperatures for circumstellar envelopes. Also we intend to include spectral lines in this code, mainly those for simple atoms (suc as H and He) and also for more complex molecules (such as CO, PAH). Those lines are related to observed transitions in young circumstellar disks (Herbig), Be and super-giants B[e]. Besides that improvement we also have to improve the emission calculation in the continuum for several physical processess, specialy for free-free type and bound-free type emissions. The images generated using FRACS code for continuum regions and lines calculated will be used in order to analyse those observations performed by VLTI (AMBER, MIDI, MATISSE) and ALMA, as described in ?Mapping prebiotic carbon compounds in protoplanetary disks, ALMA proposal?Janot-Pacheco, E., Lage, C., Chesneau, O., Suarez, O., Domiciano, A. de S., Carciofi, A., Lopez, B., Vakili, A., Bendjoya, P. 2013.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Correo de aliases em imagens de modelos realsticos estelares

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Auxilio na co-orientao de IC, junto ao Prof Marco Gubitoso (IME_USP) no Projeto FRACS. O programa FRACS (Fast Ray-Tracing Algorithm for Circumstellar Structures) tem sido amplamente utilizado por grupos de astronomia para simulao de aspectos astrofsicos em discos circunstelares. Este programa utiliza a tcnica de ray-tracing para gerao de imagem estelar bidimensional e baseado em quadtrees para distribuio de processamento numrico. No entanto, para valores fsicos de entrada extremos esta imagem final apresenta anomalias, sem interpretao fsica. O objetivo deste trabalho eliminar estas anomalias sem interferir na modelagem fsica e sem impactar o tempo de processamento.
